column5: Looking for a link to a website that shows a method of cleaning Northern Pike that leaves you with five pieces of meat. I know I have seen it out there somewhere, just can't seem to locate it. If someone knows the technique or a website that shows it I would appreciate it. Al
I use the five piece method to fillet pike. What's your e-mail and I'll try to explain it.
Here's another great reference for filleting: http://www.fishontario.com/articles/...ish/index.html
Never heard of the 5 piece method...does it waste more meat than the traditional Y-boning technique?
Have a look at this! Sorry it is in french but I think you should get the idea.http://www.putfile.com/media.php?n=Cleaning-Pike-French Regards, Snowball
Why not just get the nobones about it video and have one boneless butterfly fillet! It comes out in 1 complete pc no bones and the bones come out in 1pc too without any wasted meat.
Have a look at this. There is a sample of the zipper method for pike.http://www.nobonesaboutit.com/ Regards, Snowball
Thanks for the help guys! the french video was the one i was looking for. Knew i could count on the walleye guys for some Pike help ;-) Al
